champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Department of Youth and Sports of the Lutsk City Council. Direct management is entrusted to the main panel of judges and the NGO "KORDON Children's Sports Club"

The chief judge of the competition is Bohdan Serhiyovych Mandrykin (Lutsk)
Deputy chief judge - Ihor Rostislavovych Girskyi (Lutsk)
Secretary of the competition – Hlushchuk Taras Oleksiyovych (Lutsk)

Competition judging is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the International Kyokushinkai Karate Organization (5 judges, flag signaling).

Venue of the competition: Lutsk (KZ "DYUSSh No. 3 of the Lutsk City Council", Hlushets St., 20)

The competition is held on November 17-18, 2023

Regulations of the competition

November 17, 2023 (Friday):

  • 10:00-12:00 – arrival of teams. pre-weighing
  • 13:30-16:00 - weighing of participants, mandate committee
  • 16:30-18:30 – judges' seminar
  • 19:00-20:00 - drawing of lots

    • November 18, 2023 (Saturday):

  • 09:00-09:30 – ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09:30-12:30 - qualifying matches in the "kumite" section
  • 13:30-15.00 - qualifying matches in the "kumite" section
  • 15:30-17:00 – the start of the final part of the competition
  • 17:00-19:00 – end of competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners

    • Categories of kumite boys:

    • 2015-2016: -20.0, -25.0, -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, 45+
    • 2013-2014: -25.0, -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, 50+
    • 2011-2012: -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, -55.0, 55+
    • 2009-2010: -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, -55.0, -60.0, -65.0, 65+
    • 2007-2008: -50.0, -55.0, -60.0, -65.0, -70.0, -75.0, 75+
    • 2005-2006: -60.0, -65.0, -70.0, -75.0, -80.0, 80+

    Categories of kumite girls:

    • 2015-2016: -20.0, -25.0, -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, 45+
    • 2013-2014: -25.0, -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, 50+
    • 2011-2012: -30.0, -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, -55.0, 55+
    • 2009-2010: -35.0, -40.0, -45.0, -50.0, -55.0, -60.0, -65.0, 65+
    • 2007-2008: -50.0, -55.0, -60.0, -65.0, 65+
    • 2005-2006: -50.0, -55.0, -60.0, -65.0, 65+

    Match times of e categories of participants born in 2009-2016:

    • qualifying matches: 1.0 min., 1.0 min., binding decision of judges
    • semifinal/final: 1.0 min., 1.0 min., 1.0 min., binding decision of the judges

    Time of matches of e categories of participants born in 2005-2008:

    • qualifying matches: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., mandatory decision of the judges
    • semifinal/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 1.5 min., binding decision of judges

    Competitors must have a qualification degree of no less than 8 kyu (series A), no higher than 9 kyu (series B).
    Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition.
    Participants compete in sports uniforms and mandatory personal protectors, according to the Rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine.

    The organizing committee can make the following changes to the provisions of these competitions:

    • merge or add weight and age categories
    • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion

    FEE FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE CUP – 700 UAH.

    Winners and prize-winners are awarded with prizes and diplomas of the respective degrees.

    Competition organizing committee:

    +38-096-383-78-72 – Bohdan MANDRYKIN
